Sentencas: Electrochemical vapor deposition (EVD) is a key technology for making thin layers of the solid electrolyte as well as the interconnection material of the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: In addition to EVD several advanced deposition techniques for SOFC components and SOFC stacks have recently been reported.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: Among these techniques are thermal spraying and laser spraying techniques, while the chemical aerosol deposition technology holds promise for utilisation in SOFC technology.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: One of the major drawbacks of gas-phase deposition techniques is the low growth rate.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: To circumvent this problem a combination of the EVD process and thermophoresis assisted chemical vapor deposition (TA-CVD) has been developed by the present authors.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: This latter process is also referred to as particle precipitation aided-CVD (PP-CVD).
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: With the PP-CVD technique growth rate increases in the order of 100-1000 can be achieved.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: The principles of these advanced deposition techniques will be reviewed.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS

Sentencas: Characteristics of layers of SOFC components and SOFC stacks will be discussed.
Titulo: THIN-FILM TECHNIQUES FOR SOLID OXIDE FUEL-CELLS
